intro: Pentadenia crassicaulis, commonly known as the broad-stemmed pentadenia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by elliptical, woody fruits. It is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
